importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the news event (the Chiefs vs. Raiders game) was reported in the public domain.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timestamp of the article's publication, indicating when the event was reported to the public.

keyTakeAways: Patrick Mahomes used a ruse involving loud verbal cues to deceive the Raiders into relaxing, allowing a successful play to follow.
The Chiefs won 31-0, marking their most lopsided shutout of the Raiders in 133 meetings.
The Raiders had only three first downs and 96 yards of offense, the worst offensive performance in franchise history.
The Chiefs had 434 yards, 9 of 15 on third down, and held the ball for 42 minutes, 8 seconds.
Raiders suffered multiple key injuries: Brock Bowers (knee), Jakobi Meyers (knee/toe), Maxx Crosby (knee), and Adam Butler (back).
Raiders quarterback Geno Smith had a poor performance, going 10 of 16 for 67 yards and fumbling the first snap after Kenny Pickett took over.
Kareem Hunt was involved in the game-winning play after Mahomes' ruse.
The game featured multiple Chiefs players with receptions, including Travis Kelce, Xavier Worthy, Rashee Rice, and Marquise Brown.
Raiders coach Pete Carroll admitted the team was struggling and described the game as an 'uphill battle'.

namedEntities.name: Patrick Mahomes
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: American professional football quarterback for the Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Mahomes executed a deceptive ruse during the game by shouting loudly, fooling the Raiders into relaxing, which ultimately led to a successful play and a decisive win for the Chiefs.

namedEntities.name: Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional American football team based in Kansas City, Missouri
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Chiefs defeated the Raiders 31-0, marking the most lopsided shutout in their 133-meeting history, highlighting a dominant performance against a long-time rival.

namedEntities.name: Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional American football team based in Las Vegas, Nevada
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Raiders were thoroughly outperformed, suffering multiple injuries and poor offensive execution, leading to a 31-0 loss to the Chiefs and a significant setback in their season.

namedEntities.name: Geno Smith
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Quarterback for the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Smith had a subpar performance, going 10 of 16 for 67 yards and fumbling the first snap after Kenny Pickett took over, contributing to the Raiders’ poor outcome.

namedEntities.name: Kenny Pickett
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Quarterback for the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Pickett took over after Geno Smith and immediately fumbled the first snap he took, adding to the Raiders’ early defensive and offensive failures.

namedEntities.name: Kareem Hunt
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Running back for the Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hunt received the ball after Mahomes' ruse and successfully advanced for a first down, leading directly to a touchdown and a pivotal moment in the game.

namedEntities.name: Pete Carroll
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Carroll expressed concern about the team’s injuries and performance, acknowledging that the Raiders were struggling and described the game as an 'uphill battle'.

namedEntities.name: Maxx Crosby
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Pass rusher for the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Crosby suffered a knee injury late in the first half, leading to his removal from the game and contributing to the Raiders’ defensive deficiencies.

namedEntities.name: Adam Butler
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Defensive tackle for the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Butler was injured with a back injury, further weakening the Raiders' defensive line during the game.

namedEntities.name: Brock Bowers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: All-Pro tight end for the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bowers was ruled out due to a knee injury, reducing the Raiders’ receiving depth and offensive options.

namedEntities.name: Jakobi Meyers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Wide receiver for the Las Vegas Raiders
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Meyers was ruled out due to knee and toe injuries, limiting the Raiders’ wide receiving corps and depth.

namedEntities.name: Xavier Worthy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Wide receiver for the Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Worthy, healthy after an injury in the opener, caught three passes and contributed with a 13-yard end-around.

namedEntities.name: Rashee Rice
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Wide receiver for the Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rice returned from a six-game suspension and caught two of Mahomes’ three touchdown passes, contributing significantly to the Chiefs’ offense.

namedEntities.name: Travis Kelce
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Wide receiver for the Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kelce recorded 54 yards receiving and was a key contributor to the Chiefs’ offensive success.

namedEntities.name: Marquise Brown
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Wide receiver for the Kansas City Chiefs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Brown caught his third touchdown in two games and was a consistent threat on the receiving end.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a decisive 31-0 victory over the Las Vegas Raiders, the Kansas City Chiefs exploited a strategic ruse by quarterback Patrick Mahomes, who loudly shouted a curse phrase to deceive the Raiders into relaxing, allowing a successful play to follow. The Chiefs, who held the ball for 42 minutes and recorded 434 yards, finished off a dominant drive with Kareem Hunt’s first down and a touchdown. In contrast, the Raiders struggled with injuries to key players including Maxx Crosby, Brock Bowers, Jakobi Meyers, and Adam Butler, and performed poorly offensively with just three first downs and 96 yards. Despite a strong effort from Chiefs players like Travis Kelce, Xavier Worthy, and Rashee Rice, the Raiders were unable to mount a meaningful response, marking their worst offensive performance in franchise history and their most lopsided loss to the Chiefs in over a century of rivalry.
title: Chiefs Use Deceptive Ruse to Shatter Raiders' Defense in 31-0 Victory
